text: A FREDHOLM ALTERNATIVE FOR QUASILINEAR ELLIPTIC
EQUATIONS WITH RIGHT HAND SIDE MEASURE
Abstract. We consider a quasilinear elliptic equation, with right hand side
measure, which does not satisfy the usual coercivity assumption. We prove an
existence result in the line of the Fredholm alternative. For this purpose we
develop a variant of degree theory suited to this setting.
Let  be a bounded and open subset of RN and let
be two Caratheodory functions. We are interested in the existence of solutions u
when  is a Radon measure on  with bounded total variation.
If b = 0 and {u 7 div[a(x, u)]} is a coercive Leray-Lions operator from
(), then the problem has been the object of several papers.
Let us mention in particular [7], where the existence and uniqueness of an entropy
solution is proved when  is absolutely continuous with respect to the p-capacity,
and [12], where the existence and stability of renormalized solutions is proved for a
general . When  is absolutely continuous with respect to the p-capacity, the two
concepts of entropy solution and renormalized solution agree. A sharper result is
proved, in the case p = N , in [18], while the case of  absolutely continuous with
respect to the p-capacity is treated also in [19], provided that p  2  1/N .
If p = 2 and the principal part is linear, then much more is known, both in

been treated, under various assumptions, also for p 6= 2 in the noncoercive case.
Let us mention, in particular, the results in the line of the Fredholm alternative
proved in [4] and then developed with detailed descriptions, when resonance occurs
at the principal eigenvalue (see [25] and references therein).
Key words and phrases. Quasilinear elliptic equations, right hand side measure, degree theory.
The second author is member of the Gruppo Nazionale per lAnalisi Matematica, la Probabilit`a
e le loro Applicazioni (GNAMPA) of the Istituto Nazionale di Alta Matematica (INdAM).

In order to prove Theorem 1.1, we rst develop an adaptation of degree theory to
our setting. Since the problems with right hand side measure are usually treated by
an approximation procedure involving operators of Leray-Lions type, we choose a
development of the degree for maps of class (S)+ (see [10, 22, 24]), which naturally
In Section 2 we recall the main facts concerning entropy solutions to problems
and prove some auxiliary results. Then we introduce, in Section 3, the adaptation of
the topological degree and state its properties. With this tool at hand, in Section 4
we prove Theorem 1.1. The subsequent sections are devoted to the construction of
such a degree and the proof of its properties.
